titleStmt.title: The mariners jewel; or, A pocket companion for the ingenious Being of more general use for officers, seamen, carpenters, boatswains, pursers and stewards, then any thing yet published. Containing an alphabetical dictionary of all the naval terms; a general pay table; with a table of boatswain stores for each rank of shop; the proportion of prizes, with many other useful things both decimal and vulgarly demonstrated from a manuscript of Sir John Narbrough's and methodiz'd by James Lightbody, P.M.
titleStmt.author: Lightbody, James.
Narbrough, John, Sir, 1640-1688.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for Robert Whitledge, and sold by Alexamder Sims at the Bible in Beet-street in Hatcliff High-Way,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the Bible in Beet-street in Hatcliff High-Way
